meanings.definition: The main part of a crustacean's body, consisting of the thorax and abdomen.
meanings.sent1: The pereion of the crab is where you can see its legs attached.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the pereion of the lobster to understand its anatomy.
meanings.sent3: The crab's pereion seemed to be its favorite spot for a quick nap.
meanings.sent4: The pereion of the shrimp held the secret to its swift movements.
meanings.sent5: Children were fascinated by the pereion of the hermit crab during the beach exploration.

meanings.definition: A section of a ship's hull between the stern and the mainmast.
meanings.sent1: The sailors repaired the pereion of the ship to ensure its seaworthiness.
meanings.sent2: The captain stood on the pereion, overseeing the crew's activities.
meanings.sent3: The crew decided to have a dance party in the ship's pereion.
meanings.sent4: The pereion of the vessel held the memories of many voyages across the sea.
meanings.sent5: The storm caused damage to the pereion of the old sailing ship.
